title: 'Bodies torn into pieces': First responder describes horrific scene at train station after Russia missile strike
description: Jake Tapper catches up with a first response coordinator who ran to help after a Russian missile struck a train station in Kramatorsk, Ukraine.

title: Passengers revolt after plane is forced to land at different airport
description: Passengers on this international Jet Blue flight begged flight attendants to land early due to concerns about bad weather. Jet Blue releases a statement responding that the safety of their passengers is their top priority and their pilots are trained to manage severe weather.

title: Police release video of deadly shooting during traffic stop
description: Police in Grand Rapids, Michigan, released video of an officer's encounter with Patrick Lyoya, who died after being shot during a traffic stop. CNN's Omar Jimenez reports.

title: US military confirms an interstellar meteor collided with Earth
description: One meteor traveled quite a long way from home to visit Earth.

title: Amazon is adding a 5% fuel and inflation surcharge for the first time ever
description: Amazon said Wednesday that for the first time in company history it will charge sellers a 5% fuel and inflation surcharge.

title: Gilbert Gottfried's final Instagram post was about Chris Rock
description: Glibert Gottfried's last Instagram post invited people to weigh in on "the slap."

title: Covid shook up the world's top destination rankings. These places now lead the list
description: There are many ways to judge a city's success as a tourist destination beyond the number of visitors it gets.

title: Cedric McMillan, star bodybuilder, dead at 44
description: Bodybuilder Cedric McMillan has died at the age of 44, his sponsor confirmed Tuesday.

title: World's top oil trader will stop buying Russian crude
description: Vitol Group, the world's top independent oil merchant, will stop trading Russian crude oil and products by the end of the year, a source with knowledge of the situation told CNN.

title: World leader describes Putin's mindset during meeting
description: CNN's Becky Anderson speaks with Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer, who met with President Vladimir Putin of Russia to confront him over his actions in Ukraine.

title: Ancient altar rediscovered in Jerusalem's Church of the Holy Sepulchre
description: Pressed against a wall in a back corridor of Jerusalem's Church of the Holy Sepulchre, a stone slab bore testimony only to the graffiti etched on it by multitudes of pilgrims through the ages.

title: Germany faces $240 billion hit if Russian gas is cut off
description: Germany would plunge into a deep recession if its supply of Russian natural gas was suddenly shut off, the country's top forecasters warned on Wednesday.

title: 3 reasons Shanghai's lockdown matters to the global economy
description: China is struggling to contain an outbreak of Covid-19 in Shanghai despite a 17-day lockdown that is keeping most of its 25 million residents trapped at home.

title: Shirley Spork: Golf trailblazer and LPGA founder dies aged 94
description: Shirley Spork, one of 13 founders of the Ladies Professional Golf Association (LPGA), has died aged 94, the organization said Tuesday.

title: Never-before-seen Venice landmark opens to the public
description: Venice is famously not short of tourists, but its newest sight aims to harness the city's overtourism problem by pointing visitors towards social responsibility.

title: Intensive manhunt underway after NYC subway shooting
description: An intensive hunt, involving local and national law enforcement agencies, is underway for the man who set off smoke grenades and fired a handgun on a crowded New York City subway train, wounding passengers and setting off a panicked scramble during the Tuesday morning rush hour.

title: Los Angeles Lakers: Questionable trades, injuries and a falling star ... what went wrong with NBA team
description: Los Angeles' nickname is the "City of Angels," but this past season for the Los Angeles Lakers has been one conjured straight from the center of Dante's 'Inferno.'

title: Finland and Sweden edge closer to joining NATO
description: When Vladimir Putin launched his invasion of Ukraine, his goals were clear. He wanted to bring his neighbor to heel, assert Russian authority in Eastern Europe and make the West think twice about expanding militarily and politically toward Russia's borders.

title: New video shows what looks to be banned cluster munitions used
description: A video shared to social media appears to show possible use of banned cluster munitions in a civilian area in the Kharkiv region, Ukraine.

title: UK inflation hits 30-year high of 7%
description: British consumer price inflation leaped to its highest level in three decades last month, intensifying the pressure on embattled Prime Minister Boris Johnson and his finance minister Rishi Sunak to ease the cost-of-living squeeze.

title: The latest on the Russian invasion of Ukraine
Twitter users are exposing pro-Russian sentiment in China, and Beijing is not happy
description: Anonymous Twitter users are exposing the extreme nationalism and pro-Russian sentiment circulating online in China -- and Beijing is not happy about it.

title: The woman who turns Airstreams into beautiful homes
description: The ability to wake up in a different place every day, live and work in some of the world's loveliest places, and feel absolute freedom -- it's no wonder that many people dream of life on the road.

title: Australian man charged with more than 400 sexual offenses against children
description: A man in Western Australia has been charged with more than 400 sexual offenses against children in what police are calling one of the most significant child abuse investigations in the state's history.

title: iPhone supplier Pegatron suspends production at two factories in China
description: One of Apple's top suppliers is stopping work at its factories in and around Shanghai as the city of 25 million people remains under a strict Covid lockdown.

title: Who is Pakistan's new Prime Minister? Steel dynasty scion Shehbaz Sharif inherits an ailing economy amid political turmoil
description: Pakistan's new leader Shehbaz Sharif called for "unity" and vowed to repair the country's damaged economy after he was sworn in as Prime Minister Monday following the ouster of Imran Khan.

title: Ukraine's first lady: Russia is 'blind' to our people's suffering
Kurt Cobain's blue guitar in Nirvana's 'Smells Like Teen Spirit' video to be sold at auction
description: The iconic blue guitar Kurt Cobain rocked out with in Nirvana's seminal '90s "Smells Like Teen Spirit" music video is expected to fetch up to $800,000 when it goes up for auction next month.

title: China accuses US of 'weaponizing' extended Shanghai lockdown
description: China has lashed out at the United States for ordering its consulate staff to leave the locked-down city of Shanghai, accusing officials of "weaponizing" the financial hub's failing attempt to contain the spread of Covid-19.

title: Shipping generates more CO2 than aviation. This solar-powered boat could change that
description: For his first few days at sea on the MS Porrima, Gunter Pauli was stunned by the silence aboard his solar-powered ship.

title: Gilbert Gottfried, comedian and actor, has died
description: Gilbert Gottfried, a comedian and film and television actor with a distinctly memorable voice, has died after a long illness, his family announced on Tuesday.

title: Kids of the Kremlin enjoyed luxurious lives in Western Europe and the US while their parents rail against the West
Investigators identify subway shooting suspect after finding credit card at the scene
Amid war crimes investigation, Putin speaks out on war in Ukraine
description: CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports on the painstaking work that is going into investigating alleged Russian war crimes in Ukraine.

title: He sat next to the alleged NYC subway shooter. Survivor details moment from hospital bed
description: New York City subway shooting survivor Hourari Benkada joins CNN's John Berman from his hospital bed after 10 people were shot and at least 29 people were treated at nearby hospitals for injuries, none of which were life-threatening, according to hospital representatives. The New York Police Department said they are seeking a "person of interest" in connection to the shooting.

title: Russia's brutal new tactic leaves death 'to lie in wait' for returning Ukrainian citizens
description: CNN's Nima Elbagir reports on a Russian military tactic that aims to cause destruction even after their forces have left cities in Ukraine.

title: Ukraine's first lady: 'Don't get used to our grief'
description: In an exclusive interview with Christiane Amanpour via written correspondence, Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska reflects on her husband President Zelensky's leadership and her message to the world.
